title: Prayer for Deliverance
shortSummary: Psalm 55 is a heartfelt plea from David expressing deep anguish over betrayal by a close friend and the surrounding violence and deceit. It highlights the pain of personal treachery, the desire for God’s intervention, and the assurance of His sustaining power amid adversity.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and king of Israel who expresses his distress and calls upon God for help and justice.

keyCharacters.name: The Betrayer
keyCharacters.description: A man described as David’s equal and companion who betrays him with deceit and hostility.

definitions.definition: A term meaning 'instruction' or 'contemplation,' indicating the psalm is intended to impart wisdom.

outline.heading: David’s Cry for God’s Attention
outline.description: David urgently calls on God to hear his prayer, describing his inner turmoil and fear caused by enemies and oppression.

outline.heading: Desire to Escape and Plea for Justice
outline.description: David expresses a longing to flee his troubles and asks God to intervene against the violence and deceit prevalent in the city.

outline.heading: Betrayal by a Close Friend
outline.description: David reveals the pain of betrayal by a trusted companion, emphasizing the deeper wound caused by treachery from one near to him.

outline.heading: Confidence in God’s Deliverance
outline.description: Despite his distress, David commits to praying continually, trusting God to save him and bring justice upon his enemies.

outline.heading: Description of the Betrayer’s Deceit
outline.description: David exposes the betrayer’s hypocrisy, whose smooth words conceal harmful intentions and broken promises.

outline.heading: Call to Cast Burdens on the Lord
outline.description: The psalm concludes with an encouragement to trust God with one’s burdens, affirming His sustaining power and ultimate judgment on the wicked.

application: When facing betrayal or deep personal pain, bring your honest emotions to God in prayer, trusting He hears and cares.
Seek refuge in God’s presence rather than fleeing from trials, knowing He sustains and delivers His people.
Maintain integrity and faithfulness in relationships, and pray for those who betray or harm you.
Cast your anxieties and burdens upon the Lord daily, relying on His strength to uphold you through difficulties.

keyVerses.text: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the unique pain of betrayal by a close friend, a deep wound that resonates with many believers.

keyVerses.text: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful encouragement to trust God with our troubles, assuring His sustaining care for the righteous.

keyVerses.text: As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.
keyVerses.significance: David’s confident declaration of faith in God’s saving power, modeling persistent prayer in adversity.
